labels.analysis: The Farcaster MCP Server is designed to interact with the Farcaster Network, a decentralized social network protocol. The core functionality revolves around fetching and retrieving posts (referred to as "casts") from the Farcaster ecosystem. The server provides tools to retrieve casts from specific users (by FID or username) or channels, making it a utilization-focused tool for accessing Farcaster content programmatically.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Social Media" was chosen because the server's tools align with fetching and interacting with content from a social platform (Farcaster). The secondary label "Web Search & Research" is included because the tools enable querying and retrieving specific content, which can be useful for research or content aggregation. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories sufficiently cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: get-user-casts
tools.description: Get casts from a specific Farcaster user by FID

limit.description: Maximum number of casts to return (default: 10)

tools.name: get-channel-casts
tools.description: Get casts from a specific Farcaster channel

limit.description: Maximum number of casts to return (default: 10)

tools.name: get-username-casts
tools.description: Get casts from a specific Farcaster username

limit.description: Maximum number of casts to return (default: 10)

tools.name: get-user-casts

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@manimohans/farcaster-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
